data.title: Fixed palette of all TS weapons that don't use the effect palette
Added UseInfantryDeath option to RenderInfantry trait
data.body:
This allows the use of RenderInfantry for units that do not have a Die voice or die(0) sequences.
Fixes crash upon destruction of Titan/Wolverine in TS mod.

Might come in handy for cyborg destruction logic as well.

Additionally fixed Wolverine stand and shoot sequences.

data.title: Sometimes war factory is also selected when selection box is used
data.body: Sometimes, not always, war factory is also selected along with other units when the rectangular selection box is used. Then the cursor is the one for waypoint setting and when clicked not only the units move but also the waypoint is changed. I haven't tried it with barracks.

data.title: MLRS turret keeps "twitching" between up and down position, when tracking a moving target
data.body:
Not sure why this happens, exactly. Sometimes it's when the MLRS is rotating to track the moving target, but only sometimes. 

Better behaviour would be for it to stay up until it has reason to put it down (receives new orders to move).

data.title: Turreted units wait until they are in range of target before aiming turrets
data.body:
It would make more sense if a turreted unit would rotate its turret around to face the target it is chasing as soon as it gets the order to attack, as opposed to waiting until it drives into range, and only then beginning to slowly rotate its turret to aim. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1863799-turreted-units-wait-until-they-are-in-range-of-target-before-aiming-turrets?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement attack waypoint
data.body:
While setting a waypoint for a production facility, if "a" is pressed, the cursor changes to attack move but it actually does nothing, waypoint is not set. If clicked, the cursor changes back to normal waypoint one.

It would be better if there also was an attack waypoint.

data.title: Building is not placed if a unit moves onto the tiles at the last moment
data.body:
1) Tiles are all white, I click to place the building
2) After I click to place it but before it is built, a unit moves onto one of the tiles where the building should stand.
3) Building is not built. I have to click the build palette and choose it again to place it

No tiles were red before placing the building and there was no "unable to build" warning sound.

This is easily reproducible by having a building ready and placing it on an area where a unit is just about to move into.

It seems like there is a delay between placing a building and the time it is actually built. If, during this time, a unit moves onto the tiles of the building then nothing happens.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1862774-building-is-not-placed-if-a-unit-moves-onto-the-tiles-at-the-last-moment?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Walls on radar map
data.body:
Should walls be shown on the radar map? It is misleading that they are shown just like enemy units or buildings. Maybe they could be shown in neutral color.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1862467-walls-on-radar-map?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Unit `shok` does not have a sequence `die-crushed`
data.body:
While testing out the new-lua PR, I got this after about ten minutes of shellmap:

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `shok` does not have a sequence `die-crushed`
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SequenceProvider.GetSequence (System.String unitName, System.String sequenceName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.PlayThen (System.String sequenceName, System.Action after) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Effects.Corpse..ctor (OpenRA.World world, WPos pos, System.String image, System.String sequence, System.String paletteName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Render.RenderInfantry+<SpawnCorpse>c__AnonStorey1.<>m__0 (OpenRA.World w) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.TickInner (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
*** Error in `/usr/bin/cli': double free or corruption (out): 0x00007fd5c80194d0 ***
Stacktrace:

  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) Mono.Audio.AlsaDevice.snd_pcm_hw_params_free (intptr) <0xffffffff>
  at Mono.Audio.AlsaDevice.Dispose (bool) <0x0004f>
  at Mono.Audio.AlsaDevice.Finalize () <0x0001d>
  at (wrapper runtime-invoke) object.runtime_invoke_virtual_void__this__ (object,intptr,intptr,intptr) <0xffffffff>

Native stacktrace:

    /usr/bin/cli() [0x4b73d8]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0(+0x10340) [0x7fd642e99340]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(gsignal+0x39) [0x7fd642af9f79]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(abort+0x148) [0x7fd642afd388]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x741d4) [0x7fd642b371d4]

    [0x40660edb]
```

data.title: Spawnchoice
data.body:
CHANGELOG entry proposition (if pull accepted):
Added numbers to spawn points on map preview

data.title: Chat window improvements
data.body: Trying to close #5191, I noticed a few other things which I've resolved here.

data.title: New Lua API.
data.body:
This introduces a new scripting API built on [Eluant](https://github.com/cdhowie/Eluant) and the native lua library.  The main focus of this implementation was building a self-consistent and self-documenting API (generated using the  `--lua-docs` utility command, and available [on the wiki](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/New-Lua-API)).  Secondary benefits are that it is faster than Kopilua and doesn't leak memory everywhere.

This is going to take a while to properly review, so i'm filing this now. There ~~are two~~ is one main TODOs left to finish:
- ~~Packaging changes: we can use the system lua for linux platforms, but will need to ship lua on Windows and OSX. We should also credit the new thirdparty bits in AUTHORS.~~
- ~~Eluant.dll includes a bunch of now-redundant changes. I need to create a public fork, revert the changes we don't need, and file upstream prs for the ones that we do.~~

This implements enough of the API for the shellmaps, but no more.  A future PR will introduce a `ScriptPlayerProperties` implementation that exposes mission objectives and victory conditions.

data.title: Added "Capture-the" Flag
data.body: ![kl9jxbk](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2795984/6bbc96dc-cc03-11e3-8d25-a1965eed236b.png)

data.title: Fix build palette showing too many queued items when BuildLimit is reached
data.body:
When a BuildLimit on an actor type is set and nearly reached, you could
shift-click the build palette and it would show it had five more units
queued when really less are allowed to be built. This fixes the text
overlay so that it shows the correct number of items that will be built.

data.title: Check buildlimit when shift-queuing.
data.body:
This prevents players from building more than N number of units.
For example if you shift-queue Tanya you will get 5 when you should only be allowed to build 1.

data.title: balance tweak - make turret armor heavy
data.body: Since turrets have wood armor, they can get killed by flame tanks uber fast. It might be best if turrets are a counter to flame tanks, rather than their prey. If they have heavy armor, they will take far less damage, and not die instantly to a flame tank rush, making them able to contribute to some defense.

data.title: Makes rank chevron palette customizable
data.body: Pulled out from #5182.

data.title: Loading performance measurements
data.body:
Write out-of-game performance measurements to perf.log.

Output sample:

```
[...]
StartGame
|   PrepareMap
|   |   LoadRules: 519 ms
|   |   SequenceProvider.Initialize: 874 ms
|   : 1517 ms
|   NewWorld: 187 ms
|   LoadComplete
|   |   LoadWidgetAtGameStart.WorldLoaded: 11 ms
|   |   ScreenMap.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   ScreenShaker.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   BridgeLayer.WorldLoaded: 5 ms
|   |   ShroudRenderer.WorldLoaded: 1 ms
|   |   DomainIndex.WorldLoaded: 121 ms
|   |   ResourceClaimLayer.WorldLoaded: 1 ms
|   |   ResourceType.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   ResourceLayer.WorldLoaded: 7 ms
|   |   ResourceType.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   SmudgeLayer.WorldLoaded: 3 ms
|   |   SmudgeLayer.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   PathfinderDebugOverlay.WorldLoaded: 0 ms
|   |   SpawnMapActors.WorldLoaded: 479 ms
|   |   LuaScriptInterface.WorldLoaded: 994 ms
|   : 1623 ms
: 3382 ms
[...]
```
- Change the ambiguous Stopwatch.ElapsedTime() from a double to a TimeSpan
- Remove the unused Timer.cs and create PerfTimer for easy time measurements of code blocks
- Add several PerfTimer measurements
- Simple optimization on Map.ComputeHash()

data.title: Engineer repair improvement
data.body:
im trying hard to get more use out of him by using him to repair important buildings , the construction yard for example ... 

it often fails on the fact , that the engineer has to reach the "center" of a building to enter it ... 
in the case of an contruction yard , its like 1,5 cell walking above the building before the repair triggers ... that is enough time for my enemy , to destroy the building with like 1 hp left , or even kill the engineer "walking above the building" before he reaches the center 

yellow point is the trigger (or it feels like that atleast) : 

![3time](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2771879/fc5e62a2-ca72-11e3-93a0-450095e4a17a.png)

![trigger](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2771810/56d55332-ca71-11e3-82e6-5e97c709bbc6.png) 

since there is not really alot use for engineers anymore ... i suggest we make it more easier for him to save a building from being destroyed ... let him enter the building on the first cell of the building he touches ...

data.title: Palette fixes, art additions and minor fixes for TS mod
data.body:
Most, possibly all palette issues should be taken care of with this.

Some other, minor things have been adressed as well.

data.title: Updated psydev's maps
data.body:
Maps are now updated and more fun. Mostly start locations and tiberium fixed. 
For hegemony_or_survival, big additions in detail to the map.
Some have been renamed to what I originally intended, instead of their temporary stand-in names.

data.title: Issue #4650: Abort Mission Confirmation
data.body:
Adapted the confirmation dialog from the CnC mod and wired it to
the "Abort" and "Surrender" buttons.

data.title: RA Mammoth tank needs balance work
data.body:
- Increase cost slightly to $2000
- Make it take a little longer to build
- Rework tusks to act like the original game's
- Reduce self healing rate to 1/4 or 1/2 of what it currently is
